meanings.definition: The quality or state of being like a pig in behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: Her pigginess showed when she ate with her hands and made loud noises.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was amused by the pigginess of the muddy pig rolling in the dirt.
meanings.sent3: The pigginess of the messy eater made everyone at the table chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His pigginess in devouring the cake was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The pigginess of the piglet's snout covered in mud was adorable.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being greedy or selfish, especially in regards to food or possessions.
meanings.sent1: His pigginess at the buffet left little food for others to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: The pigginess of the child hoarding all the toys upset the other kids.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly accused her friend of pigginess for taking the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The pigginess of the squirrel gathering nuts for winter was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The pigginess of the dog guarding its bone was comical to watch.
